title: IDE with debugging for docker using ignition

content.raw:
This is not a bug. It’s a question how to do debugging with IDE \(e.g. eclipse\) with ignition in a docker container. 

In Gazebo 9 without docker I was using eclipse as the IDE and could use the debugging in eclipse. This worked fine. Now I’m trying to get eclipse running with docker to debug our own programed nodes. 

For me there could be two options for this:

1. Running eclipse on the host machine and building for a container. There are build settings in the properties to configure a container, but this seems to be only available for Managed builds not for cmake or catkin. Another option might use the eclipse Launch pad. There you can define the container were the program shall be run or debugged. But I can’t get this working \(“…no such file…”\).  
2. Another option could be to run eclipse directly in the docker container. Unfortunately I’m new to docker and do not know how to configure a docker container to get eclipse added to it. 

How do you debug your programs in docker? Any hints are really appreciated.
